fields: Note: We cannot differentiate Taenia solium and saginata on basis of size and shape of the egg

Hymenolepis nana
 Polar thickenings and central hooklets are seen

Trichuris trichura  / Whip worm

Barrel shaped/Dumbell shaped egg with Mucus plug on both sides

Enterobius vermicularis (pin worm)
Planoconvex egg, tadpole like larvae, Non bile stained egg

Ancylostoma duodenale
Segmentations/ Blastomeres are present
Non bile stained egg

Giarda lambia 
4 pairs of flagella
Fallingg leaf like motility

fields:
Diagnosis: Enterobiasis
Test to diagnose: Cellulose tape test
Treatment: Albendazole
Strongyloides: Larval penetration of intact skin.

Ascaris
Fecal-oral; Knobby coated, oval egg seen in feces under microscope

Disease: Loa Loa, swelling in skin, worm in conjunctiva
Vector: Deer fly, horse fly, Mango fly: Chryosops
Drug: Diethylcarbamazine

Disease: Onchocerciasis
Skin changes, loss of elastic fibers, river blindness (black skin nodules, “black sight”); allergic reaction possible.

Vector: Female black fly.

Drug: Ivermectin (ivermectin  for river blindness).
The dark circular inclusions in the photography represent <u>ingested erythrocytes</u> within the trophozoite
The dark circular inclusions in the photography represent <u>ingested erythrocytes</u> within the trophozoite

Taenia solium ☀️ (sun in solium)

Rostellum ✅

Pork meat

Cysticerus cellulose (found in man and pig)

Disease:

Intestinal tapeworm: uncooked pork

Cysticercosis: Feco oral

taeniasis due to T. saginata or T. asiatica has no major impact on human health. 

No Rostellum seen. (no sun like in solium)

Giardia lamba
An oval-shaped cyst with a prominent, double-layered wall is visible in the center of the image. The cytoplasm contains four nuclei, which are identifiable as spherical structures. It also contains an axostyle, a fibrillary structure from which the flagella of the trophozoite arises.
